intro: Monnina weddelliana, commonly known as Weddell's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of hair, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Monnina weddelliana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
